title: For Sale:  2011 Bowtech Invasion CPX
postcontent:
Here is a 2011 Bowtech Invasion CPX now in good condition. In 2011, Bowtech released the Invasion which featured the new Center Pivot Extreme riser design, OverDrive Binary Cam system, pre-loaded, seven-layer HardCore Limbs, FLX-Guard cable containment system, two-piece DymondWood grip and a set of vibration damping accessories. BowTechâs new Center Pivot Extreme (CPX) riser has extended ends that sweep back to meet the limb approximately halfway along its length. This places the pivot point of the limb behind the deepest part of the grip and is, by definition, a deflex geometry riser. Benefits of a deflex riser include inherent stability and accuracy provided by this torque-resistant configuration. The test bow shined brightest in this area, demonstrating amazing stability and a deadly still aim. The center-limb support also reduces overall limb movement, which reduces shock and vibration at the shot. 
IBO speed for the Invasion CPX is 343 fps. The power behind the performance is found in BowTechâs OverDrive Binary synchronized dual-cam system.
This bow is set up for:
29" Draw Length and 60 lb draw weight. 
Purchase price was over $1000. Only used 2 seasons (2-3x per season) leaving it in good condition. Asking price is :$725 looking to sell outright but open to trades for guns such as a Ruger SR9 and Walther P95(plus cash on gun trades).

title: For Sale/Trade:  AKM (AMD-65)
postcontent:
For your consideration I have a well built, well taken care of Hungarian AMD-65 with some upgrades and accessories. My only reason for selling is I have my eyes on another gun, I honestly hate to see this gem go. It has a side folder wire stock, but it has absolutely zero wobble, locks up tight, and is sturdier than your average wood stock on an AK. This rifle has a 12 inch chrome lined barrel with a permanent 4 inch muzzle break that is welded on to comply with NFA regulations. It has a hogue pistol grip (Olive drab), tapco g2 trigger (3-4 pounds) that came with it when I paid $799 for it. I since added an UTG metal quadrail (very sturdy, no wobble) a amd65tech.com sling adapter, magpul ms2 sling, magpul angled foregrip (olive drab) and 3 tapco 30 rounder mags all olive drab. This rifle is very accurate, I've put approx 700 rounds through it (all tulammo) and never had a misfire, jam, or any sort of malfunction. very manageable recoil. This weapon was completely redone by TGI, have original box from them. It's not the barebones AMD65 that was imported and sold as is, has a lot of new american parts in it.

AMD65 with tapco g2 trigger/hogue grip: $799

title: For Sale/Trade:  Kel-Tec Sub 2000 Sub2K + Acc BRAND NEW! 9mm Glock 17 format
location: St. Paul, Minneapolis / St. Paul, Minnesota
postcontent:
Hi there,

I have a Kel-Tec Sub 2000 in 9mm Glock 17 format.  I also have several accessories that will come with the rifle.  I have purchased the keltec rail accessory that allows attachment of VG/Light/Laser etc.  I also have 3 great products from tacticool.  See below for full descriptions.  Everything included + the rifle is BRAND NEW, NEVER FIRED, with all original boxes, documentation, tools, etc.  I waited 8 MONTHS after putting down money for this awesome little rifle to come in but I've since changed the main caliber of my SHTF weapons.  As a result, this baby needs a new home.  I'd love to keep it and am still somewhat on the fence about selling it, but as a poor student there's only so many firearms I can indulge myself in at any one time, so if I get the right offer I'll have to say goodbye, but the price has to be right.  If you've been frustrated by Kel-Tec's crazy slow manufacturing speed and you NEED this thing now, shoot me an email and lets work something out.  See below for detail/photos:

1. Kel-Tec 9mm Sub-2000 Glock 17 format with 17 round glock OEM magazine 

2. SUB-397: Picatinny Rail for SUB-2000. Attaches conveniently to the bottom of the forend.  (value $30 with shipping)

3.  SUB-2000 Buffer Cylinder  (9.50 + shipping)
For a little pistol carbine, the Kel-Tec SUB-2000 has quite a kick.  It's so fun to shoot, it's easy to go through a few hundred rounds, and you'll be feeling it in your shoulder tomorrow.  Now, there's a simple and inexpensive solution that eliminates over 30% of the felt recoil.

4.  SUB-2000 Bolt Tube Cover  (13.50 + shipping)
The Kel-Tec SUB-2000 carbine is fun to shoot, but the cheek weld to the steel bolt tube is a source of some discomfort.  The heavy bolt recoils inside the bolt tube which is in contact with the shooter's cheek.  The steel bolt tube is also a good thermal conductor, transferring heat or cold into the shooter's cheek.  The Bolt Tube Cover insulates the shooter from the shock loads and temperature extremes, greatly increasing the comfort when shooting the SUB-2000.  It also provides a tough rubber armor for the bolt tube, making it an even tougher little go-anywhere, do-anything carbine.

5.  SUB-2000 Operating Handle Cover  (4.50 + shipping)
The Kel-Tec SUB-2000 carbine is fun to shoot, but the steel operating handle isn't very ergonomic, and pulling back the bolt to chamber a round or verify the chamber is empty can tweak your finger.  The SUB-2000 Operating Handle Cover is a quick and easy way to increase the comfort and make the SUB-2000 friendlier to shoot.

title: For Sale:  Kar98a ERFURT 1915 GERMAN MAUSER
postcontent:
Kar98a No capture markings, no WWII markings, no import markings, nothing but Imperial proofmarks, and arsenal stamps. Original correct never blued bolt, with knurled underside of bolt handle. A bit sloppy when all the way back at the stop, but bolt cycles perfectly and action locks tight. Head space is correct using a field guage, though I've never fired it. 

Butt plate, bolt, safety, cocking piece, bolt sleeve, extractor, firing pin, front and rear trigger guard screws, floor plate, follower, trigger guard are all original stamps, and  numbers match the receiver. The bolt stop is also stamped but non-numbers matching.
Though I haven't done anything but lube it in the 20+ years I've owned it, this old boy has led some sort of life somewhere. The numbers and marks are there and visible, but they are neither crisp, nor bold.   

This is not some MM electro-pencil "force matched" collection of parts, it's the real deal. 

As far as I can tell, the stock appears to be the original walnut, but as you see it was sporterized - the popular thing to do with Mausers in the 30s. They even checked the fore end and the grip. The other thing that was done during the sporterization was it was rebarreled with a Springfield '03 barrel in .30-06 also popular during the 30s I'm told. Apprently set up scope only (I didn't get one). 

Taking up space in the safe that I need for something else and it should be with someone who truly appreciates it. Straightforward resto only needing a stock, barrel, and number matching bolt stop.   

I have more photos if you have a part you wish to see more closely. 

314.5sixsix.four269

SMITH & WESSON INC

M&P 15 Sport

5.56 NATO (223 Remington), 16 in, 6 Point Collapsible Stock, Black Finish, 30 Round Detachable Magazine

This rifle was built for the price conscious user who is looking for a good quality and inexpensive AR15 style rifle for range practice and/or home defense. They were able to do so by changing some features that should NOT upset the majority of target shooting users out there. The barrel used is made in house â 16? without m203 cuts, melanite coated inside and out, 1:9 twist rate, and 5R rifled. The 5R rifled barrel designs have been in use by Thompson Center, a S&W owned company, for a long time in order to produce an inexpensive and very accurate product. Those looking for a milspec rifle, this isnât the one for you, but melanite has proven itself a durable, corrosion resistant, uniform coating that can be considered more accurate than chrome lining. Other differences on the Sport models include: an upper receiver lacking a dusk cover and forward assist, a lower receiver with integral enhanced trigger guard, LMT style removable rear sight and A2 style front sight, chromed gas key and bolt carrier and other standard A2 styled parts. For those budget conscious shooters out there looking for a rifle that offers good quality with a low sticker price, the M&P15 Sport rifle may be just what youâre looking for.

title: For Sale:  New VLTOR MUR1a AR15 upper receiver
postcontent:
Finally, after months of waiting I got another order for the prized MUR1a uppers. These are going fast I only have 4 left. If you want one I suggest you contact me quickly as they will not last long. 

The Modular Upper Receiver (MUR) is a rigid MilSpec flat-top upper receiver made to fit all AR15/M16/M4 rifles and carbines. The MUR was developed to give the customer a MilSpec correct upper receiver with a thicker wall, making the MUR upper receiver a stronger platform. This more rigid upper receiver will increase accuracy and reliability, while extending the life of the interfacing components, such as the bolt carrier group and barrel assembly.

The main benefit of the MUR is that it is dimensionally correct. Vltor ensures reliability and accuracy of our production process by using precision machining equipment, thorough quality control inspections, and a 100% final check of all critical dimensions. When you own a Vltor MUR, you have the highest quality upper receiver available on the market today.

The MUR is made from a 7075 aircraft-grade aluminum forging. Prior to machining, the forging is fully stress relieved, heat treated, aged twice and undergoes a proprietary cryogenic treatment. The MUR is precision machined and each part finished by hand. There is not a  better upper receiver available.

The MUR comes in two models: one with a Bolt-Assist/Shell-Deflector and the second with a Shell Deflector only. Vltor offers the selection at the time of purchase, but does not offer  a  service to exchange the Bolt Assist or Shell Deflector. All MURs feature a MilStd-1913 scope mounting rail and come equipped with an Ejection-Port, Dust Cover Door.

 If multiple uppers are purchased then I would be willing to negotiate on price.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Letter painting, feed ramp polish, misc services
postcontent:
Hello I offer a few "gunsmithing" services to help out the average joe. Always open to cash or trade for pretty much anything firearm related.

-Engraved letter painting: I paid the letters on AR15, GLOCK, Springfield, etc. see below picture of an AR15. I painted it, installed the trigger guard, and then I put KNS pins on it afterwards.

- Feed ramp polishing: I polish feed ramps of many kinds, help increase reliability with a smoother feed ramp. I can take out minor dings and dents. The polishing process also removes stuck carbon that is almost impossible to remove.

- Small installations: AK47 rails, AK muzzle breaks, AK grips, AK stocks, ak quad rail accessories, etc, AR15 standard rails, AR muzzle breaks, AR iron sights, AR gas blocks, AR grips, quad rail accessories, AR stocks, AR dust plate cover, AR trigger guards, ANY ruger 10/22 upgraded chassis kit like the archangel stocks or tommy gun stock, GLOCK back plates, revolver grips, sig sauer rifle (522, 556) upgrades, all mossberg accessories, rem 870 accessories, most mosin Nagant stocks and accessories, also stock free floating. And many more

- broken stock fixing and sanding. I can stain it and finish it as well.

- I can also help you plan an AR, AK, Ruger or handgun build.
I know of tons of upgraded parts for these weapons.

Please don't hesitate to shoot me an email, if I can't figure something out, I have gunsmithing friends who love to help. I also know of someone who does duracoating, a picture of my XD is blow with his duracoat job. Thanks!

title: For Sale/Trade:  For the Shotgun Collector - Abercrombie & Fitch over under 12g
postcontent:
I'm selling an Italian made 12g, single trigger over/ under shotgun made for and imported by Abercrombie & Fitch. Long before they sold skinny jeans, Abercrombie was the the outfitter of choice for the American elite. Getting ready to go on safari in Africa circa 1920? You'd stop off in New York and pick up the necessary clothes, luggage and firearms. 
This is a well used field-grade gun with 26"inch barrels. The upper barrel is choked 3 stars or modified choke. The lower barrel is choked 4 stars or improved cylinder. This has great metal work and the wood is still in very good shape. There is freckling on the barrels and this gun has been used but there are no known cracks or defects. Lockup is fairly tight with a light bit of play which does not affect function. A smith would solve this with a larger hinge pin. I have used this shotgun on clays and had no issues.

title: Want To Buy:  Looking to purchase a higher end 1911.
postcontent:
Hello my fellow honest Armslisters.  Please read the entire article before responding.  I've got a little extra cash to spend and am testing the waters for offers to buy your higher end 1911 (and I say "higher end" because obviously some custom shop ones are going to be out of my price range).  I am interested mainly in 1911s that are valued at or around $900 - $1500.  Please reply with Make/model info, asking price, pics, round count/usage info, and list any upgrades or extras/ammo you'd include with the offer.  Wanting new(-ish) or otherwise mint condition, but if there are cosmetic flaws, please inform me including pics (would not appreciate surprises here).  Might also be interested in pieces with history, even if the actual item is valued lower than the minimum I am looking for.  Totally prefer self-illuminating Tritium sights; prefer .45 ACP but 9 or 10 mm is ok too.  Here is a list to give a general idea of my interests, 1911-style pistols ONLY:

Springfield TRP
Sig Scorpion or Compacts 
Kimber Warrior or Custom Shops
Colts in Stainless, Colt Combats, any Railed
S&W Performance Centers, Sc's, Stainless E-Series, any Railed
Para Executive Carry, Black Ops, Pro series
Dan Wesson
STI
any unique or rare models, or possibly a piece with some good (preferably verifiable) history behind it, or any used complete Nighthawk, Baer, Wilson, Brown etc. that you would like to sell quickly.

Prefer to deal with locals and inspect the item F2F, or may even possibly travel within Texas for the right kind of deal.  I'd rather not deal with private sellers from other states.

If I did not list the item you have for sale but you still think I might be interested, it can't hurt to send me the offer with requested info and pics - just please don't waste my time with unreasonable offers.
